did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: This is a collection of phonograph discs, VHS video cassettes, audio cassettes, CD-ROMs and motion picture films among other forms of media.

did.unittitle: And Women Must Weep
And Women Must Weep

scopecontent.p: National Right to Work Committee. "And Women Must Weep." 1958 (25 mins) based on the events during a strike by International Association of Machinists Local 1459 of Princeton, Indiana, attempts to show that compulsory unionism denies not only the right to work, but the right of rank and file members to disagree with the ruling body of a "union shop" union. The film prompted the IAM to produce "ANATOMY OF A LIE" which attempts to discredit the charges in this film, AND WOMEN MUST WEEP. -- 10-1/2" reel

did.unittitle: Anatomy of a Lie
Anatomy of a Lie: #94

scopecontent.p: International Association of Machinists. "Anatomy of a Lie" 1961 (25 mins) A Pro-Union production attempts to discredit charges in the National Right to Work Film, AND WOMEN MUST WEEP. The IAM challenges the honesty of WOMEN on several points: the participation of Mrs. Ruth Munroe, president of Local 1459 (IAM), the size of the group taking the strike period immediately following the production of the two films, the WOMEN film becomes something of a standard tool in anti-union campaigns and the LIE film was used by unions to refute the charges made in the WOMEN film. -10" reel in 12-1/2" can
